title: Top Places to visit in Srisailam (RFC) Township, Andhra Pradesh
content:
Srisailam is a census town in Kurnool district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the Mandal headquarters of Srisailam Mandal in Kurnool revenue division. The town is famous for Mallikarjuna Jyotirlinga Temple and is one of the holy pilgrimage sites for Saivism and Shaktism sects of Hinduism. The town is classified as both Jyotirlinga and Shakti Peetha.

 

Demographics

As of the 2001 India census, Srisailam had a population of 23,257. Males constituted 54% of the population and females 46%. Srisailam Project (RFC) Township has an average literacy rate of 75.62% higher than the state average of 67.02%. Male literacy is around 85.68% while the female literacy rate is 63.24%. 13% of the population is under 6 years of age.

 

Tourism

 

The road leading to Srisailam

Srisailam is one of the popular tourist destinations in Andhra Pradesh and considered one of the most important pilgrimage centers of Lord Shiva.

 

Srisailam Dam which was built over the Krishna river is one of the largest dams in South India.

Nagarjunsagar-Srisailam Tiger Reserve, India's largest tiger reserve is spread over 3500 km2. This Sanctuary is a natural habitat of diverse species of flora and fauna. The lush and dense Nallamala Forest range is a popular destination for trekking, hill climbing, forest exploration, and research, to which Srisailam town acts as a base camp.

Mallikarjuna Jyotirlinga enshrines Lord Mallikarjuna and is an ancient temple built in a Dravidian style with specimens showcasing the Vijayanagara architecture.

Akka Mahadevi Caves, Pathalaganga, Shikareshwara Temple are few other attractions in this place.

Government

This town hosts both the offices and residences of many A.P. Government departments and its employees A.P. Irrigation Department, APGENCO, APTransco, A.P. Forest Department.

 

Education

The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government, aided and private schools, under the School Education Department of the state. The medium of instruction followed by different schools is English, Telugu. A. P. T. W. R School (ST), A. P. T. W. R Junior College and A. P. T. W. R School of Excellence provides education to tribals.

 

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Srisailam

Satrampadu is a census town in West Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is located in the Eluru Mandal of the Eluru revenue division. The town is a constituent of Eluru urban agglomeration.

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Nidadavole, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content:
Nidadavolu is a town in West Godavari district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is a municipality and the Mandal headquarters of Nidadavolu Mandal in Kovvur revenue division.
 
Etymology
The town was known as Niravadyaprolu or Niravadyapuram.

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Chittoor, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Chittoor is a city and district headquarters in Chittoor district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh
recommendations.content: Anantapur (officially:Anantapuramu) is a city in Anantapur district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.
